publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2620# Janis Hughes: Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005—That the Parliament notes that the Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 are to be held in Glasgow from 2 to 9 July 2005; welcomes to Scotland the 2,500 athletes with learning disabilities who will participate in 23 sports at 11 venues throughout the city; notes that this will be the biggest sporting event to take place in Great Britain in 2005, and hopes that the games will demonstrate Glasgow’s ability to host such events in support of the city’s potential bid to host the 2014 Commonwealth Games.

S2M-2620 #Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 (lodged on 18 March 2005) Dr Elaine Murray*, Michael McMahon*, Shiona Baird*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Kate Maclean*, John Home Robertson*, Robin Harper*, Robert Brown*, Ms Sandra White*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Cathie Craigie*

S2M-2620 #Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 (lodged on 18 March 2005) Alex Neil*, Jackie Baillie*, Michael Matheson*, Tricia Marwick*, Elaine Smith*, Mike Watson*, Bristow Muldoon*, Fiona Hyslop*, Paul Martin*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Margaret Jamieson*, Pauline McNeill*, Frances Curran*, Donald Gorrie*, Rob Gibson*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Christine Grahame*

S2M-2620 #Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 (lodged on 18 March 2005) Karen Whitefield*, Tommy Sheridan*, Christine May*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Nora Radcliffe*, Trish Godman*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2620 #Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 (lodged on 18 March 2005) Karen Gillon*, Helen Eadie*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-2620 #Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 (lodged on 18 March 2005) Cathy Peattie*, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-2620# Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 (lodged on 18 March 2005) Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-2620# Special Olympics Great Britain National Summer Games 2005 (lodged on 18 March 2005) Bill Butler*
